page.title: 17Rivers,ponds and reservoir
page.content: The river Duddon has salmon and we can swim in it.The school pond is right outside the juniors window.It was dug up by Ulpha school children in 1979 six years ago.It is thirteen metres long.In the pond there are tadpoles,nyphms,water snails and caddis.We had frog spawn in our pond on the 13th March. The reservoir near the Pike is 680 feet up and it used to be used to top up the water when the Bobbin Mill was working.Now it has been dammed up and people swim in it. River Duddon Deep pools gorges and waterfalls and lovely scenery.Lots of tourists.Painters poems-Wordsworth. Ulpha Bridge used to be the boundry between Lancashire and Cumberland but since 1973 we all live in Cumbria.
